data.title: A nice surprise
data.text: I have to admit I was talked into eating here. I was not really into the look of the place. I was wrong, and this place was a pleasant surprise. This was some of the better pub food I have had as of late. Maybe not a perfect rating, but a pretty good place to grab some pub grub. It is on the list for a return.

data.title: Service is good, food, just ok
data.text: Went here tonight and was super excited to try something new & so close to home! It smelled like a hookah lounge as soon as we walked in, or like incense was burning. I didn't like that at all. We ordered fried oysters to start and they had lots of breading but, we're super good with the remalaude sauce! Entrees we're ok. The salmon was tastey but, the brocolli was cold. They promptly replaced it with mac n cheese witch was good. German chocolate cake togo for dessert was super good! Plus side about this place is that its open late night. I hear they also have live music sometimes. I also want to mention that during our visit, they started out playing great, classic rock! All the sudden, music volume went way, way loud. So much so to hurt your ears. This went on for almost a minute. Then silence. Then, 5 minutes later, reggae lounge time. Really weird. I will prob come back but, stick to apps and burgers. And of course bar drinks. Drink here. Eat somewhere else.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: Traveling thru the area and took in a movie and stopped into the Pub. They had a DJ and it was a very friendly and cordial place. Pub grub was very good. Wait staff was personable and professional. Plenty of parking.

data.title: Great Little Place - Where Everyone Will Learn Your Name!
data.text: We dined here for the first time a couple of weeks ago. Wow!  Just walking in, we were made to feel super-welcomed!  The bartender came over and chatted with us for a good while. We both ordered the fish and chips, and it was very good. Lots of beer choices. This is the kind of place where you will be recognized the second time you walk in and treated like a long lost friend. We are both looking forward to returning!

data.title: Not A Homie Review
data.text: I want this place to be great but our experiences (2) suggest there's more work to be done. Some places open as restaurants or bars and attract local regulars who over 50 years turn the place into a legendary hang out like Manuel's Tavern, despite its average to generally bad food. Here it seems they tried to start that way. This is a basic tavern oddly retrofitted into  a higher rent restaurant building. Not that the food is bad, its just not notable or extensive and it cant rely on legend to draw patrons. Suggestion: despite the pride our bartender showed in the food, its not as good as he and the owners and their reviewer "friends" think. Better food and more variety in the menu will bring more business despite the odd setting. The live music is great. A broader variety of menu choices will draw. The legend will follow.

data.title: Now called The Pub House
data.text: They redid the inside with rich woods and more bar space, and renamed it The Pub House.  The food is excellent!  Besides what is on the menu (good burgers, salmon, steaks, lobster dip appetizer, etc.), they offer nightly specials, which are fantastic!  We go over at least once a week--for the delicious food and the great staff!  Nights we are there it's usually Teresa, Fritz, and owner Andy, and they have always treated us like family!  Weekends usually have live entertainment (singer/guitar player) as well, and prices on everything are very reasonable.  Large beer selection, drink and shot specials too--but early evenings are family friendly!  They also have a "speakeasy" room for parties and large groups. Will DEFINITELY continue to frequent this place!  I haven't ordered anything that I haven't loved yet!!!

data.title: Go for the Pub Burger
data.text: I stopped into this place site unseen and without a review on trip adviser due to it being new. I was greeted by the bartender and grabbed a chair. Seems like there were some regulars at the bar but I did not feel unwelcome due in part to the bartender's interaction with me. I had a cocktail and ordered the pub burger and tots. The burger was amazing. It had pimento cheese and a bacon jam on top. The garlic tots were also great. The only con was the bun fell apart on me as I ate the burger. If I am ever back in town I would get that burger again.

data.title: Trying- but work in progress
data.text: We wisited "Bridges" ( previously Meat an Potatoes) on a Saturday night some weeks ago and were surprised to find the restaurant nearly empty. Live music (quite good actually!) was playing in the background as we seated ourselves at the bar and were greated by a not overly enthusiastic bartender. Drinks were good, food quite all right, and service OK. Might be back- might not.

data.title: Very good food, bar
data.text: Decided to try this after it changed from Meat & Potato.  I ordered the flat iron steak which was pretty good.  The bar I really liked.  They have a cigar room that is completely closed off and the bartender was super nice.  I will be my husband back for prime rib night.
